Key_Paper(s): Sonnenburg et al. Science 2005 (PMID 16280045); Martens et al. Nat Immunol 2008
Function_and_Unique_Features: Outer membrane TonB-dependent beta-barrel transporter; imports oligosaccharides released from polysaccharide by surface-bound CAZymes; core component of the PUL susC/D pair found in hundreds of gene clusters across Bacteroidota
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: part of the Sus-like surface machinery that concentrates polysaccharide degradation at the cell surface — convergently analogous to cellulosome scaffolding at the bacterial surface but mechanistically distinct

Key_Paper(s): Koropatkin et al. Structure 2008 (PMID 18786396)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Outer-membrane lipoprotein; forms heterodimer with SusC; binds maltooligosaccharides and starch; tetratricopeptide-repeat-like architecture; essential for substrate capture and channeling to SusC pore
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: acts as the receptor/binding scaffold that presents polysaccharide chains to the enzymatic machinery — role analogous to scaffoldin cohesin modules presenting substrate to dockerin-bearing enzymes

Key_Paper(s): Shipman et al. J Bacteriol 1999 (PMID 10464215); Koropatkin & Smith Structure 2010 (PMID 20427913)
Function_and_Unique_Features: GH13 alpha-amylase anchored to the outer membrane surface; contains an additional starch-binding domain; cleaves alpha-1,4-glucosidic bonds in starch chains bound by SusD/SusC
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: surface-anchored enzyme resembling the dockerin-borne enzymes of cellulosomes; its starch-binding domain parallels the CBM modules of cellulosomal enzymes

Key_Paper(s): D'Elia & Salyers J Bacteriol 1996 (PMID 8626325)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Periplasmic GH97 alpha-glucosidase; processes maltooligosaccharides after import through SusC; structural study revealed novel alpha-retaining mechanism in GH97 family
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: periplasmic processing enzyme downstream of Sus outer membrane complex

Key_Paper(s): Shipman et al. J Bacteriol 1999 (PMID 10464215)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Outer-membrane lipoprotein; binds starch independently; works cooperatively with SusD to concentrate substrate at the cell surface
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: auxiliary surface-binding module analogous to CBM-bearing scaffoldin proteins

Key_Paper(s): Shipman et al. J Bacteriol 1999 (PMID 10464215)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Outer-membrane lipoprotein; redundant starch-binding function with SusE; contributes to efficient substrate acquisition
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: auxiliary surface-binding module

Key_Paper(s): Martens et al. Cell Host Microbe 2011 (PMID 21925116)
Function_and_Unique_Features: GH5 endoglucanase expressed during xylan growth; part of a large PUL encoding multiple xylan-degrading CAZymes organized in a Sus-like surface complex
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: dockerin-equivalent enzyme subunit in the surface complex; no true dockerin domain

Key_Paper(s): Martens et al. Cell Host Microbe 2011 (PMID 21925116)
Function_and_Unique_Features: GH10 endo-xylanase encoded in the xylan PUL; surface-localized; attacks beta-1,4 xylosidic bonds in hemicellulose
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: surface-tethered enzyme analogous to dockerin-borne xylanase in Clostridial cellulosomes

Protein_Name: PorSS components / Por secretion system outer membrane complex (PorU/PorV)
Key_Paper(s): Glew et al. PLoS Pathog 2012 (PMID 22685406); Sato et al. J Bacteriol 2010
Function_and_Unique_Features: Type IX secretion system (T9SS) components; PorU is a sortase-like transglutaminase that cleaves and attaches C-terminal domain signals; PorV is an outer-membrane lipoprotein escort; anchors GH and virulence proteins to the outer membrane surface
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: T9SS acts as the surface-anchoring machinery for extracellular enzymes — convergently analogous to the scaffoldin-mediated surface attachment of cellulosomal enzymes in Clostridia

Protein_Name: RagB (immunodominant outer membrane protein / polysaccharide receptor)
Key_Paper(s): Shi et al. J Bacteriol 1998 (PMID 9811643)
Function_and_Unique_Features: SusD-like outer membrane lipoprotein that binds and imports polysaccharides and glycopeptides; co-expressed with RagA (SusC homolog); upregulated during nutrient limitation
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: part of a SusC/D-like system in a pathogenic Bacteroidota; highlights how the Sus scaffold architecture is conserved for surface polysaccharide capture

Protein_Name: BphP (Bacteroidophilus-type polysaccharide hydrolase complex anchor / SusD-like protein in human gut Prevotella)
Key_Paper(s): Tett et al. Cell Host Microbe 2019 (PMID 31178356); Kovatcheva-Datchary et al. Cell Metab 2015
Function_and_Unique_Features: P. copri encodes extensive PUL arrays including SusC/D-like outer membrane complexes for hemicellulose and pectin degradation; key organism linking gut microbiome to glucose metabolism
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: Sus-like outer membrane complexes for complex carbohydrate acquisition; studied in context of type 2 diabetes

Protein_Name: CipA-related scaffoldin homolog (putative cohesin-containing protein in Bacteroides cellulosolvens)
Key_Paper(s): Giulietti et al. Environ Microbiol 2018; Yutin & Galperin Environ Microbiol 2013 (PMID 23865839)
Function_and_Unique_Features: B. cellulosolvens is one of very few Bacteroidota with reported cellulosome-like activity; genomic analysis suggests cohesin-dockerin-like interaction modules distinct from Firmicute cellulosomes; degrades crystalline cellulose
Cellulosome_Notes: Potentially a TRUE cellulosome or very close analog: among the most compelling candidates for a native Bacteroidota cellulosome; cohesin/dockerin modules differ structurally from Clostridium type

Key_Paper(s): Lee et al. Mol Oral Microbiol 2013; Sekot et al. J Dent Res 2011 (PMID 21803794)
Function_and_Unique_Features: S-layer component anchored via T9SS; carries glycoprotein modifications; outer layer forms a regular 2D lattice on the cell surface; presents glycoside hydrolases and other virulence enzymes to the host tissue
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: T9SS-anchored surface lattice resembles scaffoldin-mediated assembly; the S-layer provides a structural scaffold for extracellular enzyme display

Key_Paper(s): Lee et al. Mol Oral Microbiol 2013
Function_and_Unique_Features: Second S-layer subunit; forms heterodimer with TfsA on outer surface; together TfsA/B form a regularly ordered surface array resembling scaffoldin-mediated enzyme display
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: scaffoldin-like surface display

Key_Paper(s): Larsbrink et al. Nature 2014 (PMID 24463512)
Function_and_Unique_Features: TonB-dependent transporter dedicated to xyloglucan oligosaccharide import; part of an exquisitely specific 8-gene PUL that encodes the entire xyloglucan breakdown pathway from polymer to monosaccharide; landmark study of PUL specificity
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: Sus-like complex; highlights the exquisite substrate specificity of individual PULs — analogous to the substrate specificity provided by cohesin-dockerin pairing in cellulosomes

Key_Paper(s): Larsbrink et al. Nature 2014 (PMID 24463512); Tamura et al. Nat Chem Biol 2017
Function_and_Unique_Features: Xyloglucan-binding SusD homolog; PDB structure shows tight binding to xyloglucan oligosaccharides; pairs with BACOVA_04502 to capture and import xyloglucan degradation products
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: substrate-binding scaffold in the outer membrane complex; structure solved

Protein_Name: BT_0330 (Bacteroides thetaiotaomicron hybrid two-component sensor / TonB-ExbBD energizer complex component)
Key_Paper(s): Martens et al. PNAS 2008 (PMID 18505837)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Part of the SusR/BT0330 sensing and regulation node; senses extracellular polysaccharides and coordinates PUL expression; connects polysaccharide sensing to transcriptional upregulation of Sus-like complexes
Cellulosome_Notes: Regulatory component: coordinates surface complex assembly in response to substrate availability — analogous to regulatory scaffoldin elements in some Firmicute cellulosomes

Protein_Name: FlGH17A (GH17 glucanase in Flavobacterium johnsoniae outer membrane degradasome)
Key_Paper(s): McBride et al. Appl Environ Microbiol 2009 (PMID 19304828); Nakagawa et al.
Function_and_Unique_Features: GH17 endo-beta-1,3-glucanase encoded in F. johnsoniae; secreted or surface-displayed via T9SS (gliding motility / chitin degradation system); F. johnsoniae uses T9SS to deliver a battery of polysaccharide-degrading enzymes to the cell surface
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: T9SS-delivered surface enzyme analogous to dockerin-tethered cellulosomal enzyme

Key_Paper(s): McBride et al. Appl Environ Microbiol 2009 (PMID 19304828)
Function_and_Unique_Features: GH18 chitinase; secreted and surface-anchored via T9SS (SprB-like); attacks chitin; part of a multienzyme chitin-degradation surface complex in F. johnsoniae
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: surface enzyme complex for chitin degradation; T9SS-anchored analogous to dockerin-scaffoldin tethering

Protein_Name: SprB (surface motility / polysaccharide adhesin propelled along cell surface)
Key_Paper(s): Braun et al. J Bacteriol 2005 (PMID 16166530); McBride & Zhu J Bacteriol 2013 (PMID 23353895)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Large (~669 kDa) outer membrane adhesin delivered and propelled along the cell surface by the T9SS/gliding motor; contains multiple repeats that may bind polysaccharides; its propulsion along the surface could drag substrate toward enzymatic machinery
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: surface scaffold / propulsion element; unique mechanism of surface enzyme delivery distinct from but functionally reminiscent of scaffoldin-mediated enzyme positioning

Protein_Name: Cbp2 (cellulose-binding protein 2 / putative dockerin-like protein in Cytophaga hutchinsonii)
Key_Paper(s): Xie et al. Appl Environ Microbiol 2007 (PMID 17921280)
Function_and_Unique_Features: C. hutchinsonii can degrade crystalline cellulose without secreted cellulases; its mechanism involves direct contact between cells and cellulose; Cbp2 is a GH9 endoglucanase with a putative surface-anchoring module; may be part of a multi-enzyme cell-surface complex
Cellulosome_Notes: Potential true analog: one of the few Bacteroidota that can attack crystalline cellulose; the surface complex mechanism may represent a convergent solution analogous to cellulosomes

Protein_Name: GldJ (outer membrane lipoprotein component of gliding / T9SS)
Key_Paper(s): Braun & McBride J Bacteriol 2005 (PMID 15743945)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Outer membrane lipoprotein essential for T9SS function and gliding motility; forms part of the trans-OM complex that transports proteins to the surface; structural scaffold component
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: scaffolding component of the T9SS outer membrane complex that positions and anchors surface enzymes

Key_Paper(s): Zhu et al. Nat Struct Mol Biol 2010 (PMID 20062057)
Function_and_Unique_Features: Surface-anchored GH92 exo-alpha-mannosidase; attacks N-linked glycans; PDB structure solved; part of a multi-enzyme PUL that dismantles N-glycans in a defined order
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: surface enzyme in a multi-step degradation cascade; the ordered surface complex of GH enzymes in N-glycan PULs is conceptually analogous to the multi-enzyme architecture of cellulosomes

Protein_Name: PUL-14 SusC/D pair (pectin PUL outer membrane complex in Bacteroides thetaiotaomicron)
Key_Paper(s): Martens et al. PNAS 2008 (PMID 18505837); Luis et al. Nat Chem Biol 2018 (PMID 29581578)
Function_and_Unique_Features: SusC/D-like outer membrane complex dedicated to pectin import; the SusD homolog BT1034 has been shown to bind pectin oligosaccharides; paired with multiple GH and lyase enzymes for pectin depolymerisation
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: Sus-like complex for pectin; exemplifies the modular and substrate-specific nature of Bacteroidota surface complexes

Protein_Name: BACPLE_01528 (Gut Bacteroidetes cellulose-binding surface protein with LRR and SusD-like features)
Key_Paper(s): Hehemann et al. Nature 2010 (PMID 20376150); Hehemann et al. Nat Chem Biol 2012
Function_and_Unique_Features: B. plebeius encodes PULs containing porphyranases and agarases acquired by horizontal gene transfer from marine Bacteroidota; includes SusC/D-like surface complexes for algal polysaccharide degradation; famous for gut–ocean HGT of carbohydrate-active genes
Cellulosome_Notes: Functional analog: Sus-like outer membrane complex; notable for HGT of marine polysaccharide utilization genes

Key_Paper(s): Wang et al. AEM 2017 PMID 27742681
Function_and_Unique_Features: First protein in Bacteroidota shown to be essential specifically for crystalline (not amorphous) cellulose degradation. 205 kDa OMP with 15 PbH1 domains and novel CHU_C surface-localisation domain. Proposed core of a novel outer-membrane protein complex for cellulose decrystallisation — a third Bacteroidota strategy distinct from PUL/Sus and T9SS.
Cellulosome_Notes: Novel system: no cohesin/dockerin. Priority protein for characterising a previously unknown surface enzyme complex in Bacteroidota. Likely forms a complex with CHU_1279.

Protein_Name: ScaA1 (primary scaffoldin of P. cellulosolvens cellulosome)
Key_Paper(s): Zhivin et al. Biotechnol Biofuels 2017 PMID 28912832; Moraïs et al. J Biol Chem 2021 PMID 33744293
Function_and_Unique_Features: Primary scaffoldin of the only confirmed Bacteroidota cellulosome. 11 type-II cohesins recruit dockerin-fused enzymes; CBM3 for substrate targeting. ScaB integrates up to 10 ScaA1 units creating a 110-enzyme mega-complex. Reversed cohesin-type assignment vs all Firmicute cellulosomes.
Cellulosome_Notes: TRUE cellulosome scaffoldin. The single most important protein proving cellulosomes exist in Bacteroidota. Key reference for structural and evolutionary studies on cellulosome distribution in this phylum.

Protein_Name: RsgI4 anti-sigma factor sensor domain (Fn3-like CBM)
Key_Paper(s): Dong et al. Protein Science 2024 DOI 10.1002/pro.5193
Function_and_Unique_Features: Novel Fn3-like extracellular polysaccharide-sensing domain of anti-sigma factor RsgI4. Binds broad polysaccharide range and regulates expression of major scaffoldins (not individual enzymes) — a logic unique to P. cellulosolvens absent from PUL regulation. Represents a new type B CBM family. PDB 7CG5.
Cellulosome_Notes: Highest-priority regulatory protein for understanding why P. cellulosolvens evolved a cellulosome when other Bacteroidota use PULs. Candidate for engineering broad-spectrum polysaccharide biosensors.
